answers.answer: Yes, go to a real physician, MD ophthalmologist. In the USA find one at www.aao.org  There is a world of difference in the training and the type of exam your receive.  As an MD the ophthalmologist can also see if there might be medical causes such as diabetes, hypertension, thyroid disease. Difficulty reading would be an uncommon problem due to protonix.  You should be checked for refractive error (latent hyperopia). And convergence insufficiency.  Ask the Eye MD and their staff to do a "post cycloplegic refraction" to be sure that you are truly myopic and have not been prescribed glasses for false "pseudo" myopia.JCH MD

question: I am a 24 year old male who is slightly near sighted and wears corrective glasses.  I am on medications for acid reflux (Protonix)  I am a systems engineer , so I spend many hours at a computer.  Two weeks ago, I noticed that I could not focus on the screen , making it very difficult to read the screen.  I went to an optomitrist who told me that there was nothing wrong with my eyes, yet the problem continues, making it impossible for me to do my work.  this is now a big problem.  Any suggestions where to go next?
title: Unable to focus my eyes
